string.value: |I crossed the Desert of Death! And even here, are signs of human presence. People seem to settle anywhere.
|First of all, I need to find a workshop where I can fill up and get repaired, and then we'll see what to do.
|Here's the oil depot, got here without too much trouble. Now I'll load up the truck and trailer and head back.
Congratulations! You won the race!
You took the 2nd place prize.
You took the 3rd place prize.
You lost the race.
You wrecked the car and cannot continue the race.
False start! You have lost!
|I've dreamed of driving a car with a trailer for a long time. Dreams come true...
|My precious truck. I've missed it! Hell with the trailer, I'm fine as I am.
BUKHARA'S ELDER|Here we are at the port. Thank you for protecting us from the enemy.
|You are always welcome. Have a good trip to other lands.
|And take Lisa with you, she's not all right in her head.

BUKHARA'S ELDER|I didn't want to tell you this at first, but the man you asked about did stay in our village. He went further east. I beseech thee, don't follow him. Only death awaits you there. Or something worse than death.
|Goddamn it! What's got him so terrified? He's out of his mind, poor guy... What do I say in town now?
|And I'm gonna have to figure out a way to deal with Kef.
LISA|I don't feel well. As soon as we arrived in this desert, I felt weird somehow.
|Stay strong! I can feel that we're not far from our goal!
LISA|This is all because of you! You're the one who dragged me here, and now you're going to leave me to die in the middle of the goddamn dunes!
|[She seems to have lost her mind. Last thing I need at this moment.] Listen, Lisa, it's okay, your feet are warm. Count to ten and calm down.
LISA|I'm sorry... There's something going on with me... I'll try to control myself... This desert... It's weighing on me...
MANSUR|Crazy bastards… Where the hell do they even come from?!
HAMZA|No idea. They just show up outta nowhere and try to destroy everything in their path!
MANSUR|They don't just come out of nowhere. Maybe they're coming from foreign lands?
HAMZA|They seem to be native to our lands. Maybe something here… drove them mad?
MANSUR|I've heard something about that… but I'm not sure how connected it rea...
MANSUR|Damn it… not them again! We have to flank ‘em now or we die here!
HAMZA|Shaitans! How much longer are we gonna keep barely surviving their attacks?!
MANSUR|Calm down, Hamza. Anger won't help us now. We need to find a place to fix up before we run into another group of madmen.
HAMZA|You're right. So what were you saying before?

MANSUR|Oh right… I'm not sure if it's connected, but there was this huge disaster a long time ago — wiped out a lot of people. From what I read in old books, it wasn't even that far from here. Maybe they came from there… who knows.
HAMZA|That's interesting. And no one tried to fix what went wrong after that disaster you're talking about?

MANSUR|I can't say that, I'm afraid. Either it's not written anywhere, or no one dared to take such a risky step. Either way, I've noticed — those madmen are about our age. Could it be some kind of sickness…?
HAMZA|Oh great, you sure found someone to ask! Maybe we should find out where they're coming from first — then we can wonder how and why.
MANSUR|That question wasn't directed at you, calm down please. It was a general question — one we don't have an answer to, unfortunately.
HAMZA|Nah, I was chill the whole time. Don't sweat it.
MANSUR|By the way, I've got a book here about that disaster. Already read it — don't need it anymore. If you want, I can give it to you.
HAMZA|Why not? I'll give it a read when I've got time.
HAMZA|Right here… this is where we get our trucks back in shape.
MANSUR|Let me go first, if that's okay with you.
HAMZA|Yeah, of course. Hmm… sounds like someone's trying to reach us on the radio.
FATHER|Hamza, it's your father. Where are you?
HAMZA|I'm just driving around nearby with Mansur. What's the deal?
FATHER|Cut the joyride and head home. Got something important to talk about. And with madmen running around out there — last thing I need is you running into trouble.
HAMZA|Alright, father. I'm on my way.
HAMZA|Looks like you're all fixed up. Guess it's my turn to get my truck repaired now — wouldn't want father seeing this beat-up ride, would I?
MANSUR|Yeah, I'm good now. Hamza, I need to head home — so I'm out. Take care, brother.
HAMZA|See you later!
MANSUR|Not a bad race, huh?
HAMZA|Yeah, that was one hell of a race!
MANSUR|Where to next?
HAMZA|I don't know… maybe we can just take a drive and talk for a bit.
MANSUR|Why no...
RADIO|Attention all units! Ghadad is under attack by madmen. All in the area — immediately assist with the defense!
MANSUR|No time for joyrides! Move it — we've got an attack to stop!
MANSUR|YEEEAH! Now that was a race! And I still pulled off the win? No way!
HAMZA|Hell yeah, Mansur! You were born for this!
MANSUR|So… where to next?
MANSUR|Shaitan! So close… I almost had him!
HAMZA|Don't beat yourself up, Mansur. Next time, the victory will be yours
MANSUR|Guess not every battle ends in victory. So where to next?
MANSUR|Oh God… how many of the madmen are there?! This is gonna be a hell of a fight…
HAMZA|Move it! We can't just stand here and watch!
MANSUR|Phew… We made it.
HAMZA|Listen, this wasn't random. There's no way that many heavily armed vehicles just decided to hit the city outta nowhere.
MANSUR|Yeah, looks like a coordinated attack… though you'd think it was their first time doing it. Point is, we held up. The rest? Not our problem.
HAMZA|You're right… Have we lost anyone?
JAMIL|Yeah, and it's not just a few. Ten people were dead before you even arrived. And listen… Mansur…
JAMIL|Your sister… she was the first to fall... One of those madmen launched a rocket — she was caught in the blast...
MANSUR|Wha… How…? Those mad rakshasas killed my sister…
HAMZA|Mansur… I'm so sorry.
HAMZA|Mansur, don't you think it's time for our move? We need to find where these shaitans are coming from and cut them down before they come for us again.
MANSUR|Hamza… not now, please… just leave me alone…
MANSUR|I said… LEAVE ME ALONE!
HAMZA|Alright. If you say so.
FATHER|Hamza?! Come on, respond!
HAMZA|Father, what's wrong?
FATHER|Heard over the radio — Ghadad under attack by madmen. Are you guys okay?!
HAMZA|We're alive. We weren't in Ghadad when things went bad — got here as fast as we could. But not everyone made it out… Mansur's sister… she's gone.
FATHER|That's terrible…
HAMZA|You're not wrong… I need to talk to Mansur. Be there soon.
FATHER|Hurry up.
MANSUR|Look! That must be the one Sharaf was talking about!
HAMZA|Yellow Ural… and a blue emblem with a wolf. That's him!
MANSUR|We put a bullet in him now… or we see where that bastard's headed. Might just get lucky.
HAMZA|Not a chance.
HAMZA|Hey, you! Freeze!
ROBBER|What do you want?! Back off, punk!
HAMZA|Start by giving back what you stole, or I'll rip it out of your hands myself.
ROBBER|Kid, you're wasting my time with nonsense! Walk away. Before I decide to give your truck a little bullet therapy.
HAMZA|You think I'm fooling around?! You wanna play tough? Fine. Say goodbye to your life — cause it's your last breath.
Sharaf is dead. Now you will never know where the Bukharans are.
HAMZA|Well then… time to roll.
ADRENALINIST|Everyone, get ready!
ADRENALINIST|Number 1 takes the win!
ADRENALINIST|Number 2 takes the win!
ADRENALINIST|Number 3 takes the win!
ADRENALINIST|Number 4 takes the win!
HAMZA|So… I'm here. Time to load up.
HAMZA|Oil's been delivered. Should let Mario know.
MANSUR|Mom, Dad… hey. We need to talk — just a few minutes. Hamza and I decided to head east, to the disaster site. We think that's where madmen are coming from.
MANSUR'S FATHER|What?! Are you serious right now?! After losing a sister, you wanna go get yourself killed too?!
MANSUR'S MOTHER|Mansur… please don't do this. We can't lose you too.
MANSUR|I get it… believe me, I do. But we have to go. If not now — then when? We can't let this trail go cold.
MANSUR'S FATHER|Reasons? What more reasons do you need?! You want to dig up every last excuse for why your sister is dead? That's insane!
MANSUR|No way, Dad. It's crazy to keep defending and never strike back! We can't wait forever!
HAMZA|Mansur's right. We have to do this. My father is proud of our choice — and he believes we'll make it through.
MANSUR'S FATHER|Hamza, just shut up for a second! You're not helping! Mansur, you know how dangerous this is!
MANSUR|Yeah, I know. But we'll be careful. If we sense any danger — we turn back. Immediately.
MANSUR'S FATHER|Mansur, listen to me — this isn't some mission you just walk away from. No one's made it back. Is that really a gamble you want to take?!
MANSUR|Dad, I understand your fears. But we have to try. It's the only way to find answers — and maybe stop more tragedies from happening.
MANSUR'S FATHER|Alright, Mansur. But promise me you'll be careful — and that you'll turn back the moment things go wrong. We can't lose you too… we're still not over Musiba's loss…
MANSUR|I promise, Dad. We'll be careful. It's for her.
MANSUR'S MOTHER|Mansur. We believe in you. Be careful — come back safe and sound.
MANSUR|Thank you… I swear, we'll return.
FATHER|Hamza? Hazma, hello!
HAMZA|Yes, father, I hear you clearly. What's happened?
FATHER|Hamza! That stranger I told you about — he's talked to Akil and now he's going to the Bukharans. I guess he has the same goals as you. If you're still around — catch up with him.
HAMZA|Understood. Appreciate the info, Dad.
HAMZA|So, Mansur. Ready to pay the Bukharans another visit?
MANSUR|Let's go.
MANSUR|Hurry up, Hamza! It's a bloodbath out there!
HAMZA|I see it — just hurry up!
OLDMAN|Well, here we are at the harbor. Thanks for having our back out there.
FOREIGNER|Hope you make it through to the other lands safe and sound.

OLDMAN|Foreigner… at first, I didn't want to say anything. But yes — the man you're asking about was here. He went east. I beg you: don't follow him. There's only death waiting for you out there. Or something worse.
HAMZA|What's the plan now?
FOREIGNER|We do what we gotta do. You understand me, right?
HAMZA|Yeah, I get it. Mansur? You ready?
MANSUR|Ready. Let's move out!
OLDMAN|Looks like I can't talk you out of it… Then all I can do is wish you luck…
HAMZA|Thank you — and good luck to you too!
RADIO|Attention! Enemy incoming — heavy armor from the east! Repeat: we're under attack from the east!
RADIO|Several towns have been hit, including:
RADIO|Also, enemy forces are moving toward Ghadad — a full column is on the move.
RADIO|Everyone who can fight — rise up! Defend our land!
MANSUR|What do we do now?
HAMZA|Of course we fight! What else are we supposed to do — just stand there while these cursed kelbs slaughter our people?!
MANSUR|Alright, you got me. Let's hit Alikham first — and meet up with the others on the way to Ghadad.
|Alikham fell. You were lost with the rest who stood their ground. Your goal will never be reached.
HAMZA|Alikham is clear! Move fast — Ghadad needs us now!
|Ghadad has fallen. You perished, like the others who fought for this land. Your mission is over.
MANSUR|Shaitans! Get away from my home!
HAMZA|Move it! Get to Kef — now!
|You couldn't save Kef. You fell with the rest of the region's defenders — including Hamza's father. Your mission is over.
HAMZA|Father! Are you okay?!
FATHER|I'm fine, barely hurt. Took you long enough…
HAMZA|We were busy keeping Alikham and Ghadad from falling. Came straight here once we could.

RADIO|Attention! Attention! Oilburg needs immediate fire support — it's on the verge of falling under enemy pressure! We're calling for help from the defenders of Ghadad, Alikham, and Kef — and we need it now!
FATHER|No time to waste. Everyone to Oilburg — this ends here!
|Oilburg was lost. The explosion that tore through the battlefield claimed every soul in its reach. There is nothing left to save. Your mission is over.
HAMZA|Wait, what?! You? What are you doing here?!
SCIENTIST|Vasiliy told us to help you.
HAMZA|Wait, you can actually leave the disaster site? But Vasiliy said he couldn't!
SCIENTIST|The ship's influence isn't as strong on us — for a while at least, we can leave the crash site.
MANSUR|Wait a second… how exactly did you know we needed backup?
SCIENTIST|We heard the call over the radio. Somehow, the signal reached us, and Vasiliy sent us straight to you for backup.
FATHER|You arrived just in time. Oilburg was in serious danger — even our help might not have been enough. I know you've already answered a lot of questions, but may I ask just one more?
SCIENTIST|By all means, what is it?
FATHER|Who are you, and how exactly did you meet Hamza?
SCIENTIST|We're scientists from the neighboring region. We met Hamza when he and his friend were fighting at the madmen's base in our area.
FOREIGNER|Friend's a big word… but maybe it doesn't matter. Hell, we've been through way too much — and in such a short time, too.
FATHER|Ah, so you're the one Hamza was talking about. I'm his father — Rajah. Nice to meet you. Appreciate what you've done.
SCIENTIST|Don't mention it. Think that was the last of the madmen who tried to take you over?
HAMZA|Wish I could believe that's true.
RADIO|Attention! The invasion has been repelled entirely! All towns that were attacked are back under our control. Glory to our warriors! Eternal memory to the fallen!
HAMZA|Guess that's really it. Finally. Shouldn't we start planning what's next?
MANSUR|Fully agree.
FATHER|Then let's not waste time — we're heading back to Kef. At the very least, you need to catch your breath after all that fighting.
SCIENTIST|Good luck out there.
MANSUR|Hamza, hello?
HAMZA|Receiving loud and clear.
MANSUR|Any news? Has Foreigner checked in yet?
HAMZA|Nothing yet. Like he just… disappeared.
MANSUR|You really think he got there okay?
HAMZA|To be honest… I'm not sure anymore. Just don't want to believe something could've happened to hi...
FOREIGNER|H..l..o? C..n y..u h..a.. m..?!
HAMZA|What a?
MANSUR|Speaking of the devil...
FOREIGNER|He..lo? Ca.. y..u he..r m..?!
HAMZA|Signal's weak, but I hear you. How are things on your end?
FOREIGNER|Or..cl.. is ..oi..g to str..e th.. con..mi..on so..rc..! Be car..ul!
HAMZA|So Oracle is going to strike the contamination source soon? Did I get that right?
MANSUR|So this is it… the end is finally here.
FOREIGNER|Ta..e c..re! Se.. y.. la..r!
HAMZA|Got it. Talk later. Over.
HAMZA|Then I guess all we can do is wait…
HAMZA|WHAT A?
MANSUR|WH..T HA..PEN..G?! [Connection lost…]
HAMZA|Mansur? Mansur?

After the destruction of the source of contamination, life in Vahat and across the world seemed as though it would finally begin to heal… However, the explosion in the sky and the powerful blast that followed proved to be far more devastating than anyone had anticipated. Vahat was nearly completely destroyed, and only a handful managed to survive the chaos.

Hamza, along with the few remaining survivors, decided to leave the ruined city and cross the Desert of Death in hopes of finding refuge in the neighboring region. The journey through the desert proved to be incredibly difficult. The stress and horror of what they had endured robbed many of their focus, and some members of the group became lost in the endless sands.
Others became victims of the few remaining madmen who still roamed the desert...

When Hamza and the remaining survivors finally reached the neighboring region, they were met with a new shock. The explosion had far more global consequences than they could have imagined. Much of the region was destroyed and its people were desperate. Destruction and chaos engulfed everything around them, and hope for a better future began to fade.

Hamza realized that his mission to destroy the source of contamination had led to unforeseen and catastrophic consequences. He understood that his actions, though intended to save the world, had ultimately resulted in even greater destruction and suffering.

In this new, shattered world, Hamza and the survivors faced a difficult choice: to keep fighting for survival or to accept that their efforts had been in vain. As Hamza looked upon the ruined landscape around him, he realized that their journey toward salvation was only just beginning.

@ffffa600The Chronicle of Hamza| | | |@ffffa600Development| | |@ffffffffNikita «stakan» Kashlev||@ffffa600plot, quests, scripts, 3D modeling| | |@ffffffffSerafim «Varisane» Shagin||@ffffa600text edits, scripts, plot, development assistance| | |@ffffffffKaren Gevondyan||@ffffa600text edits, plot| | |@ffffffffEvgeny «E Jet» Kolchin||@ffffa600development assistance| | |@ffffffffGeorgy «EmerEh» Zhukov||@ffffa600Russian narrator voiceover| | |@ffffffffAleksandr «Seel» Parfenenkov||@ffffa600English narrator voiceover| | |@ffffffffIvan «Carsen» Buryashkin||@ffffa600development assistance| | |@ffffffffAlexey «__nEmPoBu4__» Smirnov||@ffffa600English proofreading| | | |@ffffa600Testing| | |@ffffffffSerafim «Varisane» Shagin||@ffffffffEvgeny «E Jet» Kolchin||@ffffffffAlexey «__nEmPoBu4__» Smirnov| | | |@ffffa600Borrowings||@ffffffffFull-size model of Sergo||@ffffa600Author:|@ffffffffMaxim «Spok» Berdnikov| | |@ffffffffDeteriorating condition effects taken from the|@ffffa600«possesed» @ffffffffmodification||@ffffa600Authors:|@ffffffffAlexey «__nEmPoBu4__» Smirnov|@ffffffffDOLBOYASCHERS_TEAM| | |@ffffffffEnding slides taken from the|@ffffa600«Improved Storyline» @ffffffffmodification||@ffffa600Author:|@ffffffffPavel «pavlikRPG» Ivanov| | |@ffffa600Credits music||@ffffffffEx Machina OST - Passage04 (AI extended)|@ffffffffGnome627 - Quiet Dialogue (Extended, Remixed)|@ffffffffAnton Popov - Dramatic Theme (Full Version)| | |@ffffa600Huge @ffffffffthanks to the @ffffa600Deus Ex Machina @ffffffffand @ffFF0000EM2ch @ffffffffcommunities|@fffffffffor the help provided during development| | |@ffffa600Thank you for playing!
Do you wish to travel to another region?
I don't know where this road leads, so I'll stay here.
There's something strange about this place. I don't want to go there.
Looks like the device that summons the boat isn't working. Or some barbarians have broken the local machinery. Anyway, I will have to drive.
|@00ffffffÀÀÀÀÀÀÀÀÀÀÀAAAÀÀÀAAAAAAA@ffffffffFew hours later...
|@00ffffffÀÀÀÀÀÀÀÀÀÀÀAAAÀÀÀAAAAAAA@ffffffffFew days later...
You failed to protect the villagers. Now you'll never reach your goal.
The trailer is destroyed. People won't cooperate with you no more.
Mansur died.
Foreigner died.
One of Bukharans died.
Warning!||Manual saving is temporarily disabled during this quest.
Warning!||You have three minutes to defend each city/village!||During the quest, entry into cities is closed!|Only gas stations are operational!
Warning!||The volume settings have been changed! If needed, check the volume settings in the game's main menu.
There are no races today! Try coming back later.
Warning!||To enter the Desert of Death, it is recommended to have a full supply of health and fuel, as there are no gas stations available on the map!
